name: Oh No! Not More Clichés Trivia Game | Idioms and Proverbs | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this expression?

"Save for a ______ day"
questions.explanation:
rainy.

	This cliché dates back over 400 years. "Save for a ______ day" means to put something aside now to be used if hard times occur in the future.

questions.text: What does the cliché "to smell a rat" mean?
questions.correct: To be suspicious about a situation
options: Someone is behaving like a rodent
You believe your property is infested
Your pet rat needs a bath
questions.explanation:
To be suspicious about a situation.

	"To smell a rat" means that you suspect that something is wrong.Other smelly expressions with a similar meaning are:"Smells fishy" and "Smells to high heaven".

questions.text:
If you can't recall something you might say-
"It's on the tip of my ______".
What word is missing?
questions.explanation:
tongue.

	The expression "It's on the tip of my tongue" is often used when we believe that we know something but need to concentrate to get it from our brain to our mouth.

questions.text: Complete this expression, "afraid of his own ______"?
questions.explanation:
shadow.

	"Afraid of his own shadow" is said about someone with a very timid nature.The phrase dates back around 500 years.

questions.text:
To "make an honest woman of her" means to punish a dishonest woman and teach her the error of her ways.
True or false?
questions.explanation:
False.

	"Make an honest woman of her" actually means:A man should marry the woman he has seduced in order to restore her reputation.

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this phrase:

"Actions speak louder than ______"?
questions.explanation:
words.

	"Actions speak louder than ______"? means: what you do is more significant than what you say.

questions.text:
Which word completes this cliché-

"To put all your eggs in one ______"?
questions.explanation:
basket.

	"To put all your eggs in one basket" means:Don't put all your resources in one place. It would be better to spread the risk.If you put all of your eggs in one basket and dropped it you would lose all of your eggs.

questions.text: What does the expression "the tip of the iceberg" mean?
questions.correct: A small part of a larger problem
options: We are all doomed:  as in the Titanic
questions.explanation:
A small part of a larger problem.

	"The tip of the iceberg" means that you can only see, or understand, a small part of a much deeper problem or phenomenon.

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this cliché?

"Batten down the ______"
questions.explanation:
hatches & hatch.

	To "batten down the hatches" means to prepare for difficulties.It has nautical origins:When preparing to meet stormy weather the sailors would "batten down", meaning to cover and secure, hatches on the hold of the ship.

questions.text: And finally, what does the expression "to take a raincheck" mean?
options: The measurement of a day's rainfall
To see if the weather forecast predicts rain
Put your hand out of the window to see if it gets wet
questions.explanation:
To defer until another day.

	To "take a raincheck" means to put an event or occasion off until a later time or date.It originated with the issuing of raincheck tickets at a rained-off baseball game.The ticket is then used for admission to a later game.
